intro: Pigea banksiana, commonly known as the Banks' pigeonwings, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It produces small, elongated fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
